result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keith Harland Bernhardt

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order. Signed by EFV on 10/27/22. ec: Attys. kma
Filed by Atty Zimmerman. arc    e: DA
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 100613,
Payable Number: 245982,
Receipt Number: 22R 014359,
Amount: $20.00

- $250.00 bond on file. 

- Defendant may retrieve personal belongings and camper from the residence in the presence of law enforcement ONLY. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, L.B..  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:12 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nicholas M Zimmerman in court for Keith Harland Bernhardt. Defendant Keith Harland Bernhardt in court. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. DE obtained private counsel. . Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court enters NG plea and reserves on pre-plea rights. Waives speedy trial. Court sets STC. Adjourned 01:16 PM
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
